kalābu： kalābu（pu）
ကလာဗု（ပု）
kalābu．
ကလာဗုမင်း။

Kalābu：King of Kāsī．

He tortured the ascetic Khantivādī who was the Bodhisatta．

He was therefore swallowed up in Avīci．

He was a previous incarnation of Devadatta．

The story is given in the Khantivādī Jātaka （J．iii．39ff； he is often referred to，e．g．，J．v．135，143ff）．

kalābu：ကလာဗု （ပု）

ကလာဗုမင်း။
